data.title: Student Organizations
data.meta_description: This vsu student life page provides information about student organizations
data.text:
ORGANIZATION

CONTACT INFORMATION

DESCRIPTION

AbstraKt Entertainment

Abstraktent08@gmail.com

Tfos7080@students.vsu.edu

AbstraKt Entertainment was made to mold, build, teach and inspire its members to become better dancers, entertainers, students and humanitarians. AbstraKt will build the community teaching health, dance education and spirituality, always striving towards the common goal.

Active Minds

Activemindsatvsu@yahoo.com

Lgra1929@students.vsu.edu

l.scott.granum@gmail.com

The purpose of Virginia State University’s chapter of Active Minds is to raise awareness about mental health and serve as a liaison between the student body and the university’s counseling center.

African Students Association

Akam1500@students.vsu.edu

Promote African culture and awareness around campus.

Alpha Kappa Alpha

Sorority, Inc.

(Alpha Epsilon Chapter)

orrdestini@yahoo.com

alphaepsilon1926@gmail.com

The mission of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated is to cultivate and encourage high scholastic and ethical standards, to promote unity and friendship among college women, to study and help progressive interest in college life, and to be of “Service to All Mankind”.

American Production and

Inventory Control Society

(APICS)

Ejon6715@students.vsu.edu

American Society of

Mechanical Engineers

Bsmi7718@students.vsu.edu

ASME’s mission is to serve diverse global communities by advancing, dissemination and applying engineering knowledge for improving the quality of life; and communicating the excitement of engineering.

Animal Science Pre-Vet Club

Kedererholland@gmail.com

Khol8700@students.vsu.edu

Association for Computing

Machinery VSU Student

Chapter

ATMAE

Jwil6550@students.vsu.edu

Beta Beta Beta Biological Honor Society

cyar7277@students.vsu.edu

The purpose of Beta Beta Beta Biology Honor Society shall be to function as an honor and professional society for students of the biological sciences. Its activities shall be designed to stimulate interest, scholarly attainment, and investigation in the biological sciences and to promote the dissemination of information and new interpretations among students of the life sciences.

Beta Gamma Sigma International Honor Society

Labb8278@students.vsu.edu

The mission of Beta Gamma Sigma International Honor Society is to encourage and honor academic achievement in the study of business, to foster personal and professional excellence, to advance the values of the society, and to serve its lifelong members.

Business Professionals of America, VSU Chapter

kcol2336@students.vsu.edu

The mission of Business Professionals of America is to contribute to the preparation of a world-class workforce through the advancement of leadership, citizenship, academic, and technological skills>.

Caribbean Student Association (CSA)

Jhadeeg28@gmail.com

Aaharris5@yahoo.com

Aharris2199@students.vsu.edu

vsucsa@aol.com

To promote an understanding if Caribbean culture & heritage on the campus of Virginia State University through community service events, social events and programs.

Circle K International

Qgra1458@students.vsu.edu

Circle K International (CKI) is an international collegiate service organization that is sponsored leadership programs of Kiwanis International. It promotes service, leadership and fellowship.

Delta Sigma Theta

Sorority, Inc.

Shainadavis2495@gmail.com

alphaetavsu@yahoo.com

Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Incorporated is a private, not-for-profit organization whose purpose is to provide assistance and support through established programs in local communities throughout the world.

E.L.I.T.E. X

Vsuelitex2015@gmail.com

deweeverguy@gmail.com

gdew3688@students.vsu.edu

The purpose of this organization shall be to recognize the need of the students/people. In addition, to promote Professional Development, Economic Development, and Ethical Ordinance. With intent to serve as a catalyst for students/peoples who shelters ideas with hopes to see them manifest.

Eta Sigma Delta International

Hospitality Honor Society

takiaarch@gmail.com

Graduate Student Association

Medw1724@students.vsu.edu

Mne929@gmail.com

The Virginia State University Graduate Student Association (GSA) is dedicated to the enhancement of the graduate experience at Virginia State University. The organization was established to serve as foundation for building unity, support, and academic excellence among students of African descent and the broader university community.

Golden Key International Honor Society

vsugoldenkey@gmail.com

Ddic3346@students.vsu.edu

flov2197@students.vsu.edu

The purpose of this organization shall be to enable members to realize their potential through the advancement of academics, leadership and service.

History Club

JMil0839@students.vsu.edu

Hospitality Management

Student Association

Jjon1626@students.vsu.edu

To prepare students to be effective and empowered hospitality leaders who can assume productive roles in an ever-changing global society.

International Diplomacy Club

Pjoh3313@students.vsu.edu

Idcatvsu@gmail.com

Ahaz8593@students.vsu.edu

The International Diplomacy Club will strive to for a deeper understanding if Economic concepts through friendly discussions and debates. Meeting to learn and teach others relevant concepts to modern events.

Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)

jess.davis37@yahoo.com

blan2700@students.vsu.edu

IEEE's core purpose is to foster technological innovation and excellence for the benefit of humanity.

Iota Phi Theta Fraternity, Inc.

sharodm@hotmail.com

etaiotas@iotaphitheta.org

spreadingstoke@gmail.com

The Development and Perpetuation of Scholarship, Leadership, Citizenship, Fidelity, and Brotherhood among Men.

International Student Organization

Awil7104@students.vsu.edu

To foster friendship, practice inclusiveness, promote cultural diversity and facilitate international unity here on VSU campus.

(The Virginia State University,

The Alpha Phi (E) chapter of)

Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc.

Kendrick.Wright1@yahoo.com

Achievement in every field of human endeavors.

Kappa Delta Pi

International Honor Society

Demetriousgray0220@gmail.com

Kappa Delta Pi strive to sustain an honored community of diverse educators by promoting excellence and advancing scholarship, leadership, and service.

Kappa Kappa Psi

National Honorary Band Fraternity, Inc.

Zetapsichapter167@gmail.com

Ehut7024@students.vsu.edu

Erichutcherson151@gmail.com

Kappa Kappa Psi is a Fraternal Organization that promotes the advancement of college and university band through dedicated service and support to bands; comprehensive education, leadership opportunity and recognition for the benefit of its members and society.

KEROJO

Modeling Agency, LTD, Inc.

Kerojomodelingagency95@gmail.com

kspr3187@students.vsu.edu

KEROJO Modeling Agency, LTD, Inc. Promotes community service through fashion.

The Ladies of Plus Size

Beautis

Jset0992@students.vsu.edu

Male Teachers Molding Minds

threemsociety@hotmail.com

tvau5357@students.vsu.edu

Minorities in Agriculture,

Natural Resources & Related

Sciences (MANRRS)

fbro8368@students.vsu.edu

The Mass Communications Club

JLaG9560@students.vsu.edu

vsumasscommclub@gmail.com

Dpat5984@students.vsu.edu

The purpose of the Mass Communications Club is to serve those interested in the Mass Communications field as well as VSU and the surrounding community.

Math Honor Society

(Kappa Mu Epsilon)

The Math Mentoring and Leadership Program ( M-Squared)

Ajoh7106@students.vsu.edu

The Math Mentoring and Leadership Program was established with the purpose of developing the abilities of K-12 students to succeed in school and in life, and in doing so involves them to efforts to eliminate institutional obstacles to their success.

The Men of New Water, Inc.

Sagewilliams66@gmail.com

The Men of New Water is an all-male mentoring organization designed to promote growth in young men by giving them tools to become exceptional citizens and future leaders.

Minority Association of

Pre-Medical Students

Kjac1321@students.vsu.edu

The purpose of Minority Association of Pre-Medical Students shall be to support current and future underrepresented minority medical students, addressing the needs of underserved communities, and increasing the number of clinically excellent, culturally competent and socially conscious physicians.

National Association for

Music Education Collegiate

J.cannon1227@gmail.com

The purpose of NAFME Collegiate is to afford students an opportunity for professional orientation and development while still in school, and to enable students to gain an understanding the basic truths and principles that underline the role of music in human life; the philosophy and function of the music education profession; the professional interests of members involved in the local, state, division, and national levels; the knowledge and practices of the professional music educator as facilitated through chapter activity; community service through engaging and enriching local music education.

National Association

for the Advancement of

Colored People (NAACP)

Jblo2279@students.vsu.edu

NAACP_vsu@gmail.com

Mtay6455@students.vsu.edu

The mission of the NAACP is to ensure the political, educational social and economic equality of rights of all persons and to eliminate racial hatred and racial discrimination.

National Association of

Black Accountants, Inc. (NABA)

Tman2000@students.vsu.edu

The mission of NABA, Inc. is to address the professional needs of its members and to build leaders that shape the future of the accounting and finance profession with an unfaltering commitment to inspire the same in their succession.

National Association of Blacks in Criminal Justice

Akin2867@students.vsu.edu

NABCJ is a non-partisan, non-profit service organization whose purpose is to examine and act upon the needs of African-Americans and other minorities employed in both the public and private sectors of the criminal justice system, and to participate in the eradication of injustice in the American justice process.

National Society of

Black Engineers (NSBE)

President: Kailyn Haye: pres.nsbevsu@gmail.com

Vice President: MaKhaila Bentil: vp.nsbevsu@gmail.com

Chapter email: chapter.nsbevsu@gmail.com

The mission of the National Society of Black Engineers is to increase the number of culturally responsible Black Engineers who excel academically, succeed professionally and positively impact the community.

Nahtonal Society of

Minorities in Hospitality

jjon1626@students.vsu.edu

National Society of Leadership and Success (NSLS)

krog5834@students.vsu.edu

vsu.nsls@gmail.com

The purpose of this organization shall be to help students discover and achieve their goals through leadership. The society will serve as an honor/leadership organization to attract and develop new student leaders, increase retention within the university, and increase student engagement.

National Society of Pershing Angels, Inc.

shanequaholloman@gmail.com

Chol3360@students.vsu.edu

The National Society of Pershing Angels is charged to foster a spirit of friendship and cooperation among women in the military department and maintain a highly efficient drill company.

National Society of Pershing Rifles Company Oscar 4

Sagewilliams66@gmail.com

The purpose of the National Society of Pershing Rifles is to develop, to the highest degree possible, outstanding traits of leadership, military science, military bearing, and discipline within the framework of a military oriented, honorary fraternity.

NOBLE (National Association for Black Law Enforcement Executives)

Kmcn8222@students.vsu.edu

jjoh7186@students.vsu.edu

The National Organization of Black Law Enforcement Executives (NOBLE) serves as the conscience of law enforcement by being committed to justice by action.

Nutrition/Dietetics Association

estermr92gmail.com

jwoo0733@students.vsu.edu

The mission of Nutrition/Dietetics Association is to provide students interested in nutrition opportunities to: build professionalism, expand knowledge of careers in dietetics, volunteer in the community, and educate the public on ways to increase quality of life through proper health and nutrition practices.

Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc.

kcar5530@students.vsu.edu

carringtonkody@gmail.com

The purpose of Nu Psi chapter shall be to bring about a union of college men of similar high ideals of scholarship and manhood.

People Against Negativity Inspiring Creativity 2000 (PANIC 2000)

(Suspended until Spring 2017)

Melvjackson@gmail.com

The purpose of P.A.N.I.C. 2000 is to provide the student body with an organization that encourages expressionistic talents such as dancing, acting, and singing. Experience is not needed just the desire to be a great performer or to be part of an excellent production.

Phi Beta Lambda

Pre-Medical/ Pre-Dental Society

The purpose of this organization shall be to provide underrepresented pre-health students with knowledge, skills and experiences that are both perquisite and concomitant to professional participation in health fields.

Pretty Girls Sweat

mne929@gmail.com

The purpose of Pretty Girls Sweat shall be to inspire students to make positive life choices to improve their physical and mental health through exercise, teamwork, nutrition, networking, their peers, mentors, fitness coaches, and health experts. Pretty Girls Sweat encourages students to “make fitness fun” and “sweat with purpose”.

Psi Chi Honor Society

jgri5089@students.vsu.edu

Psi Chi is an international honor society whose purpose shall be to encourage, stimulate, and maintain excellence in scholarship of the individual members in all fields, particularly in psychology, and to advance the science of psychology.

Psychology Club

Dwal6245@students.vsu.edu

The purpose of the psychology club is to promote the academic goals of students as related to the field/major of psychology.

PREP

Quincynieves75@gmail.com

The purpose of this organization shall be to promote, entertain, and to develop people socially on campus.

Public Relations Student

Society of America (PRSSA)

Jordanmason15@gmail.com

Rainbow Soul

Cwil7115@students.vsu.edu

To educate the campus about LGBTQ issues. To establish a campus environment free of prejudice.

Royal Court

Eact1209@students.vsu.edu

Mr. and Miss Virginia State University serve as the University’s official ambassadors and student host and hostess.

Royal Spirit Squad

suttonalonza@yahoo.com

The mission of the Royals Spirit Squad is to provide a platform that serves as a diverse spirit squad that contributes to on and off campus civic engagement, and community service for our peers.

Sankofa

vsusankofa@gmail.com

Saudi Students Club at VSU

sultanmj@windowslive.com

vsusaudiclub@gmail.com

This organization will reflect cultural scientific and historical aspects of Saudi Arabia. We will assist new students to overcome difficulties pertaining to study, accommodation and settling in. We will represent the Saudi Arabian Society and our members to VSU society and enhance a positive image about Saudi students.

Selected Ones

Selectedones.vsu04@gmail.com

Kbar2836@students.vsu.edu

The purpose of Selected One’s is to provide students with opportunities to develop cultural understanding. Selected One’s objectives are to promote academic and cultural awareness, help students maintain good ethical standards, provide organized spirit, to enhance the community and university and to raise and expand students awareness and diversity in society.

Sigma Alpha Iota International Music

Fraternity, Inc.

Kiki.ayanna@gmail.com

The mission of Sigma Alpha Iota International Music Fraternity is to encourage, mature and support the art of music.

Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority, Inc.

brittanymbrown@gmail.com

The purpose of these rules it to have an effective organization and operation of the Alpha Zeta Chapter of the University in the execution of its duties as a student organization at Virginia State University

Sigma Tau Delta International

English Honor Society

Dr. Leah Thomas

Lmthomas@vsu.edu

The mission of Sigma Tau Delta is to

Confer distinction for high achievement in English language and literature in undergraduate, graduate, and professional studies;

Provide, through its local chapters, cultural stimulation on college campuses and promote interest in literature and the English language in surrounding communities;

Foster all aspects of the discipline of English, including literature, language, and writing;

Promote exemplary character and good fellowship among its members;

Exhibit high standards of academic excellence; and

Serve society by fostering literacy.

Social Justice Club

(Formally Sociology Club)

ebro3774@students.vsu.edu

Sista 2 Sista, Inc.

Dominiqueduckett24@gmail.com

Dduc3903@students.vsu.edu

The objective of this organization shall be to join all women on Virginia State University campus, on a more personal level. Diverse in our personality, all women will bring different views concerning their experiences as individuals on campus, and in society.

Social Work Club

jbur7855@students.vsu.edu

Society of Automotive Engineers

dden2755@students.vsu.edu

SAE is a global body of scientist, engineers, and practitioners that advances self-propelled vehicle and system knowledge in a neutral forum for the benefit of society.

Society of Women Engineers

ldea6252@students.vsu.edu

Sport Management Majors Club

Iand9397@students.vsu.edu

To help students grow professionally through networking, internships, volunteer service, and job opportunities.

Student Ambassadors

Student Athlete Advisory

Committee (SAAC)

Jhic5460@students.vsu.edu

The mission of the VSU Students Athlete Advisory Committee (SAAC) is to facilitate communication about concerns, problems, or suggestions between the athletes and athletic administration.

Student Virginia Education Association

asha1762@students.vsu.edu

To inform and educate its membership on educational issues of immediate and potential importance in the commonwealth of Virginia and the nation. To foster and coordinate the development of chapters affiliated with the SVEA.

Student Government Association

swest@vsu.edu

westshai@yahoo.com

The SGA is open to all students. Students can become involved in the SGA by election to the office of class representative or student-body president or vice president or by election to a Student Senate seat or the Leadership Council.

Student Liaison Outreach Team

Vsuslot07@gmail.com

ahoward.blue@gmail.com

ahoward2098@students.vsu.edu

The purpose of this organization shall be to assist the youth in developing options and choices to take control of their lives. Will educate youth on their responsibilities to the Petersburg community, by providing them with guidance, and positive attitudes of young college students and graduates.

Tau Beta Sigma National Honorary Band Sorority, Inc.

epsilonrho@gmail.com

ofre2769@students.vsu.edu

We provide exceptional service to collegiate bands and promote equality and diversity, including empowering women in the band profession. We cultivate leadership, educational achievement, music appreciation and community development.

Swing Phi Swing

svin6244@students.vsu.edu

The purpose of Swing Phi Swing Social Fellowship, Inc. shall be to provide community service, scholarship and fellowship through discipline, effective leadership and unity; to foster and maintain better relationships among women of all races and creeds while promoting sisterhood among the membership and throughout the community.

TAMM

tcar5272@students.vsu.edu

talashadc@gmail.com

The Association of

Political Science (TAPS)

vsu.taps@gmail.com

Tidewater Pre Alumni

Khar2136@students.vsu.edu

TPAC is organized for the mutual benefit and prosperity of Virginia State University (VSU). The purpose of the TPAC is to develop string relationships, build upon the ongoing legacy, and maintain the spirits of our Alma Mater.

Trojan Activities Board (TAB)

tab@vsu.edu

choward@vsu.edu

The Trojan Activities Board (TAB) assists the Department of Student Activities in identifying, planning, implementing, and evaluating cultural, social, educational, entertainment, and recreational activities for students.

Trojan Fire Dance Team

trojanfiredt@gmail.com

The purpose of Trojan Fire is to perform at basketball games and compete throughout the region as well as against other HBCU’s or colleges. This dance team will bring diversity to Virginia State University by broadening the dance culture experience.

Trojan Leadership Program

cpriddie@vsu.edu

sflo0812@students.vsu.edu

Trojan Scholars of Speech and Debate

bmcc2816@students.vsu.edu

The purpose of this organization shall be to develop students’ public speaking, writing, critical thinking, analytical and research skills through a series of competitive debates while preparing students to become effective critical analytic contributions to society.

TRUE FOUNDATION, Inc.

truefoundation99@gmail.com

thay8030@students.vsu.edu

The purpose of this organization shall be to aid the incoming first and second semester freshman by enriching the development of their educational and moral stature.

Virginia State University Concert Choir

soundofjoyjem@gmail.com

jmor7911@students.vsu.edu

To excel musically as we achieve to be the best ambassador for Virginia State University. To make a difference in all we do separately and as a group.

Virginia State University Gospel Chorale

vsugcinfo@gmail.com

Provide Gospel music for the University and community. The VSU Gospel Chorale performs for a variety of commitments, to include public concerts, touring, church events, recording sessions, and University ceremonies.

VSU Pan-Hellenic Council

dneal@vsu.edu

The Virginia State University chapter of the National Pan-Hellenic Council Inc. (NPHC) governs the nine Greek-lettered fraternities and sororities that are members of the NPHC. The NPHC serves as an umbrella organization that promotes unity among its affiliate members and monitors their activities through an internal disciplinary board.

Walter Johnson Mathematics Club

jsho5988@students.vsu.edu

The Walter Johnson Mathematic Club was established with the purpose of generating student awareness and interest in Mathematics and related fields. The club is great for career ideas and gaining exposure to undergraduate research and internship information.
